board.name: RDK2
board.summary: The Development Kit RDK2 offers a complete solution for hardware and firmware developers and a basis for a modular toolkit, so that proof of concepts can be created in a very short time. All components of the BOM can be found in the Rutronik portfolio.

board.description:
RDK2 Features:
  • Infineon CY8C6245AZI-S3D72 Ultra-low-power high-performance microcontroller.
  • The KitProg3 Debugger based on a CY8C5868LTI-LP039 microcontroller.
  • A 512MBit SEMPER™ NOR Flash connected with microcontroller QSPI.
  • Ready-to-Use CAPSENSE™ Slider
  • A stand-alone power delivery controller CYPD3177 from Infineon and Type-C connector from JAE.
  • The AP Memory 64MBit APS6404L-3SQR-ZR PSRAM connected with microcontroller QSPI.
  • nPM1100 Li-ION Charger from Nordic Semiconductor.
  • Compact and versatile rotary switch from C&K for power sources selection.
  • The Keystone CR1220 coin battery holder.
  • The DIP switch from DIPTRONICS enables to disconnect of the RESET signal from the Arduino socket.
  • Tiny but useful potentiometer-trimmer with a knob from PIHER.
  • Micro SD Card Socket from ADAM TECH.
  • CAN FD Terminal Minitek MicrospaceTM connector in combination with CAN FD driver TLE9251VLE.
  • Test point contacts from Keystone enable current measurement using an oscilloscope or multimeter.
  • 10-pin ARM SWD Amphenol connector used for connecting third-party debuggers as J-Link etc.
  • The Buttons: High quality and durability mechanical buttons from Panasonic.
  • The Onboard Power Management: Based on Diodes Inc. and ROHM products.
  • ADAM TECH ADC-028-1-T/R-PA10T DC Connector
  • RS485 Terminal with a SP3078EEN-L/TR driver from MaxLinear.

board.description:
RDK3 Features:
  • Infineon’s High-Performance, Ultra-Low-Power Secured CYB06447BZI-BLD53 MCU with integrated Bluetooth LE.
  • The KitProg3 Debugger based on a CY8C5868LTI-LP039 microcontroller.
  • Infineon S25FL064LABNFI043 External QSPI 64Mbit NOR Flash.
  • Ready-to-Use CAPSENSE™ Buttons.
  • APMemory External QSPI 16Mbit PSRAM Memory.
  • The Keystone CR1220 coin battery holder.
  • Test point contacts from Keystone enable current measurement using an oscilloscope or multimeter.
  • 10-pin ARM SWD Amphenol connector used for connecting third-party debuggers as J-Link etc.
  • On-board 2.45GHz Bluetooth antenna from Kyocera AVX.
  • U.FL connector for the external Bluetooth antenna from Amphenol RF.
  • Kyocera AVX multilayer ceramic transient voltage suppressors for the USB.
  • Kyocera AVX 9296 series POKE-HOME connectors.
  • BD83070GWL Buck/Boost Switching mode power supply from ROHM. Easy to change output voltages between 3.3V and 2.5V.
  • Single Cell Li-ION Battery charger DIO59020CD12 with USB-OTG Boost from DIOO.
  • TCK1024G,LF TOSHIBA Load Switches (with the current limiting capability).
  • NISSHINBO low power amplifier (acts as voltage follower and buffer in KitProg3 circuit).
  • Amphenol ICC Arduino Headers. Part No: 75915-306LF; 75915-308LF; 75915-310LF;
  • DIPTRONICS tactile buttons. Part No: TBFF22KQR.
  • EVQPUC02K Right-angled tactile switch from Panasonic.
  • RM107002BCB Rotary switch for power supply selections from C&K.
  • JS202011JCQN Slider switch for power supply selections from C&K.
  • PIHER Potentiometer for ADC peripheral evaluation. Part No.: PT10YV10-103A2020-5-S.
  • Passive components from Samsung EM, Yageo, and ASJ.
  • CHILISIN Power Inductors. Part No: BKPA002012102R2M00; BDUE002520121R5MQ1; muRata Ferrite Beads. Part No: BLM15BD102SN1D.
